body: Yes. That's a very good reason indeed. Maybe in the future ðŸ˜„ . I can understand there are bigger priorities.

run integration tests

```
apachepulsar/pulsar-build:manylinux-cp34-cp34m
```

run cpp tests
run integration tests
That looks correct and you should have access now.
Thanks for the work, just trying to do the same thing.
Delayed message redelivery solution based on expose redelivery count to client. #3030

> so, what was the exact issue by keeping aj file under broker? 

Everything gets compiled through the AspectJ compiler wrapper. One example of these conflict is that Lombok doesn't work in `pulsar-broker` module. It's also causing a lot of weird interactions with IDEs. It's better to keep it separated in a smaller module which get updated much less frequently.

Image `apachepulsar/pulsar-build:manylinux-cp33-cp33m` could not be built due to an error:
```
ln: creating symbolic link `/opt/python/cp33-cp33m/include/python3.3' to `/opt/python/cp33-cp33m/include/python3.3m': No such file or directory
The command '/bin/sh -c ln -s /opt/python/${PYTHON_SPEC}/include/python${PYTHON_VERSION}m /opt/python/${PYTHON_SPEC}/include/python${PYTHON_VERSION}' returned a non-zero code: 1
```
In addition, SSL was not enabled for debian images. I will fix these issues with https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3035.
Can you try to remove â€œ -v d:/temp/data:/pulsar/data â€ to use non-mounted directory? I think the problem is how docker handle volumes on windows.

I was taking a look at that test though I don't have identified the reason for the failure. 

I was just seeing the test getting stuck in restarting the broker container when running in a loop.

I'm fine to wait to merge this until root cause is identified
Ya, I'd like to root cause it first. It's on my current in-progress queue, so shouldn't take too long.
@Ah39 it is not completed yet. there is an ongoing PIP for it.
@merlimat is this related to your recent changes for java11?
@jai1 is the right fix to increase the timeout in the test?
This seems to be fixed by #2318
@merlimat can you review this PR again?

@sijie yes, I will address this issue soon. thanks.
@sijie Yes, I think it would still be required to be fixed. In #3006 I just verified it compiles and run with Java 11 though I haven't ran the tests with that yet.
Actually the reason is fail is that boost was updated from 1.64 to 1.68 (though in a previous commit, but that image was never pushed). There should be an easy fix in the cmake file, looking at it.

I think this was actually fixed in #2590 . I haven't seen this test fail anytime recently and the test code is anyway completely different.  I've run it in a tight loop and consistently passes locally, even when running in a docker inside vm env.
@merlimat I'm already address your suggestion, thanks a lot.

before broker down zookeeper error log:
ERROR [CommitProcessor:2:NIOServerCnxn@178] -Unexpected Exception:java.nio.channels.CancelledKeyException
Seems it happens a lot these days.
@jiazhai can you post some example runs where you've seen it happen? Did it happen locally, or only on jenkins?

@ivankelly above is an example in PR #2998 
https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar_precommit_integrationtests/5056/testReport/junit/org.apache.pulsar.tests.integration.offload/TestS3Offload/tiered_storage_test_suite/
The gist is a local run I guess, given the hanzi. What class of machine was it run on?

Getdelivery count does not cover all the use cases. We are pushing the logic to determine whether the delay has expired to the client(Implementing this in all the client languages will be repetitive & some language clients may not even get this feature implemented).  If the broker sends the message to the client after the expiry of the delay then it would be simple and straightforward to remember.
@sijie is there any link to the PIP definition to share?

@kaonick great to hear that helps. I think the problem is a problem either at docker side or rocksdb side. I don't have any immediate solution to fix that. will have to search around to see if there is any solution to fix it.
@david-streamlio can you rebase this PR to latest master?

Thanks @baby1937 for reporting this.  Dumped the content out from Broker.log, and add some description in the issue.

Discussed with @baby1937 Here is the situation:
1. deploy broker and bookie on same machine.
2. zookeeper had an exception:
```
ERROR [CommitProcessor:2:NIOServerCnxn@178] -Unexpected Exception:java.nio.channels.CancelledKeyException
```
3, broker down, with above stack
```
7:13:59.449 [pulsar-load-manager-6-1] WARN  org.apache.pulsar.broker.loadbalance.impl.ModularLoadManagerImpl - Error writing broker data on ZooKeeper: {}
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException$ConnectionLossException: KeeperErrorCode = ConnectionLoss for /loadbalance/brokers/172.16.20.98:8080
        at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:102) ~[org.apache.pulsar-pulsar-broker-2.2.0.jar:2.2.0]
        at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:54) ~[org.apache.pulsar-pulsar-broker-2.2.0.jar:2.2.0]
        at org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeper.setData(ZooKeeper.java:1336) ~[org.apache.pulsar-pulsar-broker-2.2.0.jar:2.2.0]
        at org.apache.bookkeeper.zookeeper.ZooKeeperC21:07:43.427 [main] INFO  org.apache.pulsar.broker.PulsarService - Starting Pulsar Broker service; version: '2.2.0.0'
```

@baby1937 is expecting broker could tolerate zk failure instead of panic.
@jiazhai - I think it happens during broker starting up on registering itself to zookeeper. it seems that the broker can't register itself to zookeeper, so it fails to start.
@sijie It is happening after the broker runs for a period of time. After the above error occurs, the broker is down. thx.

@baby1937 but the exception was thrown before "Starting Pulsar Broker service"? are you copying the right log for the broken that crashed?


About authentication, I see that for websockets it's done 2 ways:
* with a servlet filter when embedded in the broker
* in the websocket handler (`checkAuth()`)

It even looks like authentication is done twice when embedded in the broker: once with the filter, once in the handler ! 
Shouldn't it be done only once in the filter ?

Then about authorization, the filter already gets the role and puts it in `AuthenticationFilter-role` so the handlers could get it from there.

WDYT ?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8623402/48939278-a8022300-ef4e-11e8-96fe-5307b74cbc3e.png)
@sijie it is the right log for the broken that crashed.
